instruction: Develop a hypothetical scenario showing how the article is relevant in our lives.
input: In a recent survey, 90% of participants indicated that self-care is important for their overall health and well-being.
output: John was a high-achieving student and employee. He had taken on numerous responsibilities, worked hard to please everyone, and always tried to make sure he did the best job possible. But it took its toll on John — he was stressed and tired, and his relationships with his friends and family were suffering. He had heard about the survey and the results, but he felt like he had too much to do to take care of himself. Until one day, it all caught up to him. He experienced a mental breakdown and was forced to take a break from all of it for a few weeks. It was then that he realized how important self-care was and made a conscious effort to prioritize it in his life.
